lines: Even though your mother knows that you are currently dating someone, she candidly asks if you had ever considered dating her friend's daughter, Gina. What do you think of this suggestion?
#TELL HER YOU APPRECIATE THAT SHE IS LOOKING OUT FOR YOU, BUT NO THANKS.

You don't have to be so hostile about it, but this is probably the most realistic teen-age response. She gets the message, but that doesn't stop her from dropping little hints, like, "Oh, little Gina is such a good cook. Yesterday she
made your favorite dish, chicken marengo." (You've never eaten chicken marengo in your life!)
A very sensitive response. Are you always like this?
Well, you must really be very healthy!
You get extra Trustworthy points for being honest. There's hope for you yet.
Your mom says, "She's petite, and has a very pretty smile. She's also got a LOVELY personality." Do you want to be set up with this girl?
It turns out that Gina's mom has been doing quite a bit of talking about you, too. Gina is not interested. It was her mother's line about YOUR great personality that turned her off.
I guess it was the personality thing that killed it.
